definitions.definition: An act of stretching.
definitions.example: I was right in the middle of a stretch when the phone rang.

definitions.definition: The ability to lengthen when pulled.
definitions.example: That rubber band has quite a bit of stretch.

definitions.definition: A course of thought which diverts from straightforward logic, or requires extraordinary belief or exaggeration.
definitions.example: It's a bit of a stretch to call Boris Karloff a comedian.

definitions.definition: A segment of a journey or route.
definitions.example: It was an easy trip except for the last stretch, which took forever.

definitions.definition: A segment or length of material.
A quick pitching delivery used when runners are on base where the pitcher slides his leg instead of lifting it.
A long reach in the direction of the ball with a foot remaining on the base by a first baseman in order to catch the ball sooner.
Term of address for a tall person.
The homestretch, the final straight section of the track leading to the finish.
A length of time.
A stretch limousine.
To lengthen by pulling.
definitions.example: I stretched the rubber band until it almost broke.

definitions.definition: To lengthen when pulled.
definitions.example: The rubber band stretched almost to the breaking point.

definitions.definition: To pull tight.
definitions.example: First, stretch the skin over the frame of the drum.

definitions.definition: To get more use than expected from a limited resource.
definitions.example: I managed to stretch my coffee supply a few more days.

definitions.definition: To make inaccurate by exaggeration.
definitions.example: To say crossing the street was brave is stretching the meaning of "brave" considerably.

definitions.definition: To extend physically, especially from limit point to limit point.
definitions.example: The beach stretches from Cresswell to Amble.

definitions.definition: To extend one’s limbs or another part of the body in order to improve the elasticity of one's muscles
definitions.example: Cats stretch with equal ease and agility beyond the point that breaks a man on the rack.

definitions.definition: To extend to a limit point
definitions.example: His mustache stretched all the way to his sideburns.

definitions.definition: To increase.
To stretch the truth; to exaggerate.
definitions.example: a man apt to stretch in his report of facts

definitions.definition: To sail by the wind under press of canvas.
definitions.example: The ship stretched to the eastward.

definitions.definition: To execute by hanging.
To make great demands on the capacity or resources of something.
